Description: Handleless ovoid pottery jar with a rounded base and a short everted neck (2.5cm high); ridged body, coil-built and finished on wheel. The jar is covered in a beige-cream slip, with two thin brown painted lines carelessly added to the neck and lower shoulder. The shoulder is decorated with three representations of eyes in the same thin brown paint, with a thick red outline added around the eyeball. The eyes have hatched eyebrows and a curl on the left hand side. Adams Type W.34 (Adams 1986, fig. 82).
